sources.title: Yellow Rolls-Royce (1964) Alain Delon, Ingrid Bergman, Omar Sharif, Shirley MacLaine | Rom-Com
sources.description:
A yellow Rolls-Royce connects lives across decades, witnessing betrayal, love, and courage. Charles (Rex Harrison) gifts it to his wife Eloise (Jeanne Moreau), only to uncover her affair. Gangster Paolo (George C. Scott) uses it to tour Italy, while his fiancée Mae (Shirley MacLaine) falls for Stefano (Alain Delon). Later, resistance fighter Davich (Omar Sharif) and Gerda (Ingrid Bergman) use the car to save lives during wartime, before its journey continues into the unknown.

Director: Anthony Asquith
Writer: Terence Rattigan
Genres: Comedy, Drama, Romance

Main Actors:
Ingrid Bergman - Gerda Millett
Rex Harrison - Charles, Marquess of Frinton
Shirley MacLaine - Mae Jenkins
Jeanne Moreau - Eloise, Marchioness of Frinton
George C. Scott - Paolo Maltese
Omar Sharif - Davich
Alain Delon - Stefano
Art Carney - Joey Friedlander


0:00:00 - Full Movie with dubbed audio & subtles 
0:02:06 - Chapter 1: The Aristocrat's Story
Lord Charles Frinton buys the Rolls-Royce as a gift for his wife, Eloise, but their relationship is strained by infidelity.
0:34:38 - Chapter 2: The Gangster's Story
Paolo Maltese, an American gangster, uses the car during a trip to Italy with his fiancée, Mae Jenkins, where love and loyalty are tested.
1:23:21 - Chapter 3: The War Refugee's Story
Gerda Millet, an American socialite, becomes involved in aiding a Yugoslav partisan, Davich, amidst the chaos of World War II.


@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: Three stories about the lives and loves of those who own a certain yellow Rolls-Royce: **First purchased by Lord Charles Frinton, the Marquess of Frinton (Sir Rex Harrison) for his wife as a belated anniversary present. Lady Eloise Frinton, the Marchioness of Frinton (Jeanne Moreau) finds her own use for the vehicle, one which prompts her husband to sell the car in disgust. **Gangster Paolo Maltese's (George C. Scott's) moll Mae Jenkins (Shirley MacLaine) thinks the Rolls is a "classy" car in which to tour Paolo's hometown in Italy. When Paolo is called away to the U.S. to finish some "business", a bored Mae takes the Rolls-Royce on a spin through the country, enjoying both the sights and handsome Italian photographer Stefano (Alain Delon), who crosses her path. **By the outbreak of World War II, the car has come into the possession of socialite Gerda Millett (Ingrid Bergman). While on her way to visit Yugoslavian royalty, Gerda and the Rolls-Royce become (at first) unwitting and then (eventually) most willing participants in the Yugoslavian fight.
metadata.Actors: Ingrid Bergman, Rex Harrison, Shirley MacLaine
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 2 BAFTA 1 win & 3 nominations total
